website_summaries.verdict: A well-built and reliable small solar panel hampered by a temperamental charge controller.
pros: Charges batteries to run small devices, outdoor fountains or LED lights well
Panel’s frame is very sturdy and protects panel
cons: Some users had difficulty connecting panel wiring to charge controller
20W power output is too small for some projects
Charge controller has few power indicators and isn’t reliable
Wiring connectors seem flimsy and tend to rust easily

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars. Item delivered January 7th. Worked when installed. Installed on my camper to keep the battery charged through the winter. I checked the battery voltage today, 11.9. Full sun. No glowing green light on the charge controller and no output voltage. It's dead within 6 weeks. If the seller is reading, know that my return window closed on February 6th, so I can't even submit a return.
customer_reviews.author: steve s

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: This panel works from dusk to dawn. It generates a solid 17 volt under direct sunlight and 12-17 volt with cloudy sky or 7 AM before the sun even brighten. I used it in conjunction with "USMEI Dual USB Charger Socket Waterproof Power Outlet 4.8A with 12V/24V Voltmeter LED Digital Display for Car Boat Marine Motorcycle ATV RV Campers Tractors" with no 12V battery to charge my phone when I am working outside
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Good power generation
customer_reviews.text: This creates good power. I'm using this on a chicken pen project - create/store power from the sun to run an automatic door opener. Everything I did works perfectly - this panel adequately charges a deep cell battery. I would next time not use the small controller they send, it doesn't tell you enough information.
customer_reviews.author: E. Solch

customer_reviews.title: Used item for my RV/camper to keep my battery's charged ...
customer_reviews.text: Used item for my RV/camper to keep my battery's charged for 5 days between use to keep the fridge running. I run two battery's and make sure the only thing on when i leave is the fridge...and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Mike

customer_reviews.title: Ok panel, dead solar controller
customer_reviews.text: The headline sums it up, panel seems to function ok, build quality is ok, solar controller (not as pictured in the ad), feels cheaply built, and did not function on arrival, LED's did not light, and there was little to no output voltage when tested with a multi-meter. This product is obviously a build it yourself kit made up of a small solar panel, a junk solar controller, and a decent looking set of battery clips. Note assembly requires wire stripping and a precision flat head screw driver. The only reason I am giving 2 stars is that the panel does function
customer_reviews.author: Penguin Life

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a minimal off-grid system to be used for camping to charge phones and run some LED lights. The quality of the panel and wires is very good. The charge controller is a little cheap looking but very adequate. I paired it with a 18Ah lead acid battery. I haven't had a chance to use it camping but in home testing it can keep the battery topped off with very minimal direct sun during the day. I have been charging 2 phones daily and running 2 4.5W light strips for 2 hours/night. Not a huge task but the panel is in 90% indirect sun.
customer_reviews.author: BE from ME

customer_reviews.title: Panel well built
customer_reviews.text: Like most things from China there is little in the way of instructions. The controller is semi self explanatory. I wonder if it is waterproof. The panel seems well made sans any indication of mounting holes or suggestions. I placed it in full sun and connected it to the battery. Battery voltage was 12.61v when I began. A couple of hours later it was 12.83v. Panel was laying flat horizontal to the ground, nowhere near where it should be pointed. It is doing the job of trickle charging the battery. I would purchase again and recommend if your looking for a battery tender.
customer_reviews.author: Smalls

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! Edited to add - except...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this last November to try and keep my lawn tractor's battery charged during the winter. Mounted the solar panel on the South facing wall of my shed, the controller inside. Just started the tractor up, (4/5/20), and it is like a brand new battery. I had previously tried one from Harbor Freight, but it was not effective at all. Fast forward to 2020, I ordered a second unit for my brother-in-law. Opened the box well past the 30 day return window and the unit was DOA. T-shooting indicated zero output from the solar unit. I found a cold solder joint at the connection, re-flowed the solder and now it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Techmike

customer_reviews.title: controller junk
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice panel and so far good out put from it, sturdy well built, battery clamps are descent and wiring seems right size and good quality, -- but when i hooked it to my bike batt. I noticed voltage going down, so no lights lit on controller Hmmm. Tested output 6.5 volts, tested panel 17.2. Tried another battery same result. Hooked panel to another controller worked great. Tried controller with a different panel 6.5 output, soooo- Im saying controller junk. Another roll of the dice on CE
customer_reviews.author: pickerguy

customer_reviews.title: Charge controller didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to power a CPU style fan in my solar space heater. Out of the box the charge controller didn't work so I've wired the fan directly to the CPU fan. Since the fan is variable speed and the panel can't exceed the power consumption of the fan it's a non issue that the charge controller doesn't work. However if you were buying it and needed the controller I would look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: J. Young

customer_reviews.title: not happy
customer_reviews.text: this product never worked for me , got in contact with provider but no resolve
customer_reviews.author: Jesse H.

customer_reviews.title: Voltage Controller/Regulator is junk
customer_reviews.text: My automatic gate solar panel died after almost 15 years. I thought this panel would be a good replacement and adds a voltage regulator as well. I can't fully express my dissatisfaction with the design and quality of the controller/regulator. I attempted to connect this but the screw down terminals won't hold the wires in place. The tabs on the side of the plastic case are so fragile that you can't expect it to last very long. This makes the brand 'Eco-Worthy' destined for the recycle bin and not a working system.
customer_reviews.author: Renda Overbo

customer_reviews.title: Panel and replacement regulator work great!
customer_reviews.text: The voltage regulator does not work. Input voltage 16.8v, but battery output at source was 0.6v and the load output port was 0v. See images for proof. I even took video. The only reason why this was a “good deal” was because it came packaged with a voltage regulator. Unfortunately the regulator does not work, making this a not wise buy. UPDATE: I received a replacement two days after notifying Amazon and it works perfectly. Very rapid response and the product is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Jessica & Richard

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little panel
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little solar panel that I use for charging two 12 volt batteries. I use the batteries to run a water pump attached to my rainwater collection system.
customer_reviews.author: CylonGolfer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, Easy to setup!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying this solar panel is the best I’ve ever purchased! It was an absolute breeze to set up, because for once the instructions were perfectly clear as to how to set it up! It took me all of 5 minutes to have everything up and running. So easy that you could keep this in your vehicle for emergencies if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Snow

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very pleased. The instructions were clear and the product easy to install. I did locate the controller in a weather proof box based on another review showing rust on it's connectors. The output voltage from the controller is what I would expect for a 12v battery when it's getting full sun.
customer_reviews.author: Dean C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap controller. Burned up after 2 months use.
customer_reviews.text: Headline pretty much says it. Used it for about 2 months in a water proof scenario and one day after flowing a few amps through it for about 20 minutes solid versus the intermittent use it was getting... a strong burning electrical smell came from it for when I used it for the next couple of times and then it just quit. The solar panel has been pretty solid and the 2 together kept my 12vmower battery charged the whole time running an rv water pump once a night for about 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: bev01470

customer_reviews.title: Not charging at 20 watts, but it is good for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: It is producing 13.5 Watts for me. Even with sun overhead. I did replace the wires with heavier guage wire based on another review before installing. Perhaps it is my cable. I will try new cable next year and see what happens. I use this on my sailboat to add charge to the battery. Since the motor is hardly run, it doesn't get recharged enough after starting motor and using it for instruments and lights.
customer_reviews.author: Beachdog3

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: In short, not worth buying, after a month the best I can get out of it is 5.4 volts on the brightest of days pointing it directly at the sun, it actually drains my small 32ah battery rather than charging it
customer_reviews.author: jesse g.

customer_reviews.title: This was a great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Compact solar charging for my Mighty Mule automatic gate opener battery. So far (Since October, 2108) this solar panel and charge controller has kept my battery fully charged. Going in to winter months now so I will update this review in a few months. The quality seems to be very good (I have Renogy Solar Panels for other applications) and when comparing with other panels I have purchased, this Eco-Worthy panel is comparable in quality and workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: but there are items at HD that work just fine. Also note that the terminal block on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Keep in mind that no attachment brackets are supplied, but there are items at HD that work just fine. Also note that the terminal block on the back of the panel is not flush with the panel frame. It extends about 1/4" out of the frame. The panel mounting will have to account for that.
customer_reviews.author: Ron A.

customer_reviews.title: Free energy
customer_reviews.text: I like this solar collector. It helps to keep my rv batteries charged. However, I wish I had gotten the larger one. This one maintains, but will not quite charge. If you just want to maintain and not add additional charge, this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: garhar42

customer_reviews.title: Watch /check the short harnesses for correct polarity first
customer_reviews.text: Product seems ok , but wiring was crossed on the short harnesses going to the battery ( reversed polarity) and burned out the solar charge controller , so no more control box & putting 20 volts into truck battery .Guess quality control isn't like it used to be .
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Charge it up!
customer_reviews.text: Well built solar panel and controller that is easy to install. The only issue I had with it is written wiring instructions were not helpful! They talked about amps, mounting and such but nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Lawman102

customer_reviews.title: Controller may be bad
customer_reviews.text: I installed this several months ago and it seemed to work fine. Now the "load" led light stays on all the time even after removing all wires from the battery except for the clips to the controller. I've asked support for help but have recvd no contact from anyone. I'll try to submit an update if I hear from them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to plug in & produce 12V.
customer_reviews.text: So, I haven't actually screwed or glued this to my RV yet but it took less than 5 minutes to read the installation instructions and start making power. Looking forward to years of off-the-grid camping.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the system In April 2016 and was used for an electric fence charger. Panel used to charge the battery. Considering the price compared to other units, I thought a somewhat upscale unit would be worth the money. It currently is only putting out 4 1/2 volts. I did E-mail the company, but only 1 year warranty, so out of luck on a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: geezer11

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I used this to put 12v lights in my shed that has no power .. It was very simple to connect.. Just follow the directions for order of connections to the controller .. I used a small motorcycle battery and it powers 3 12v lights very easily .. The controller makes sure the battery stays charged .. I recommend for this kind of use.
customer_reviews.author: MikeS

customer_reviews.title: I'm not so sure it's actually worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: if your battery that you're trying to charge doesn't have at least 12 volts it's not going to work very well for charging it. I had to charge my battery before I could use this to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne D.

customer_reviews.title: No deciperable mounting instructions...
customer_reviews.text: Interestingly enough, your instructions under the section 5.0 Mountings, " The ECO PV modules is contingent upon modules being mounted in accordance with the requirements described in this section (please turn over the page) " . Upon turning over the page, the text is all in German... how helpful!
customer_reviews.author: J McDonald

customer_reviews.title: WHAT?
customer_reviews.text: Check the rating system for this SOLAR panel... Rate the warmth? rate the thickness? rate the sheerness? like just about ALL amazon stuff, POORLY PACKAGED.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hemp

customer_reviews.title: this kit is actually a 12volt kit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set with the intention to charge my 24 volt military generator batteries but apparently I have to purchase another solar module to connect it in series with the one that comes with this kit. Bummer! I thought I was purchasing a 12 or 24 volt solar charger but the solar module only puts out 17.9 volts, so, It cannot charge my 24 volt batteries (28 volt while charging)
customer_reviews.author: Lombardo Fierro

customer_reviews.title: Good little panel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would keep/charge a battery in a truck that I don't drive often and it not only keeps the battery topped off but did fully charge the battery from almost dead. The only down side it the lack of instructions for the solar charger. But it would not too hard to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: adams

customer_reviews.title: Provides no voltage
customer_reviews.text: I did not have a chance to open the package until 6/20 and installed on my plane. Did not work at all. I realize it's after the "return" time envelop but I'd appreciate a waiver on the time. I'd need a few days to get out to the airport and uninstall panel.
customer_reviews.author: Richard  Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the fencemgoing
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Using on 12v electric fence to recharge the battery, works really well so far. Bought a second panel for another pasture.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Brend

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The manual says it comes with a small u bracket..... not in package. Inquired of seller who said it doesn't come with bracket. Returned it. Buying something else
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: It's a solar panel ,1 each.
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was very timely. Unit looks to be of quality construction. Installed on he boat and it is charging the 100AH battery. So far, it's good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Hannick

customer_reviews.title: good tricle charger
customer_reviews.text: have this keeping the battery charged on a large farm tractor that is mostly retired and has no access to power. So far it works great
customer_reviews.author: N. Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: Not working for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have it hooked to two new deep cell batteries and I am trying to run 1 USB plug for a motion camera. It won't charge enough to run it. We have had nothing but sunshine and I have new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Great product missing the controller
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a great unit however didn't come with the control Box and there's no way to contact the seller? Anyone know how to
customer_reviews.author: harvey s. meshel

customer_reviews.title: Isn’t able to charge a car battery
customer_reviews.text: The main reason we wanted this was to back up a car battery that loses charge. If that’s your reason, I wouldn’t purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep a charge on my automatic gate. The construction feels good and sturdy. I have happy with it. The I am getting 10w out of it so that's good. It comes with a short wire connected to the panel that is soldered on the small terminals under a black cover. I do wish these were screwed on instead so I could attach longer wires without having to crimp connectors on them. It does come with a longer set that connects to a voltage regulator.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Can put out about 1.1 amps in full sunlight
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for burning man to charge a 12 v battery. Sturdy panel. The voltage regulator is a toy though. Don't trust it at all to last a long time. On a full sun day with the angle optimized I could get 1.1 amps output on the output of the regulator.
customer_reviews.author: r570sv

customer_reviews.title: Good charger good price
customer_reviews.text: I like that it works so very well. I use it to keep the cranking battery on my sailboat charged. Even on a cloudy day, it stays above 12 VDC. I didn’t like that I needed to go out and buy a tiny flat head screwdriver to add the wires to the charge controller. But it is a really great solar charger. I will be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon L. Serna

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Liked the first panel so much I bought a 2nd. Keeps the starting battery on my Mhome at full charge. 2nd panel is for the boat battery. Just remember that polarity matters when hooking up 12 volt systems.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa B

customer_reviews.title: Good for the proce
customer_reviews.text: Nice small panel. I use it in my shed to run a sound machine to keep rodents away
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: caught fire
customer_reviews.text: Controller caught fire when I hooked it all up. Not worth the risk of trying again!
customer_reviews.author: Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equiptment.
customer_reviews.text: i hooked this solar unit to my boat power controller. I have 2 12v motorcycle batteries wired in parallel to operate bilge pump, nav lights and sound system. This panel and controller keep it at top charge. Great product. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Failsafe

customer_reviews.title: Nice one
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my 5th wheel batters and truck. It has been doing a great job of keeping them charged.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi Yarborough

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. A piece came defective and the supplier sent a new one at no cost just after checking that I connected it properly. Excelent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Campuzano

customer_reviews.title: Worked well it did what it said
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the battery of the Troll Motor on the boat, my husband left his keys in the truck ignition and kill the battery when we were camping and it charged up in 20 minutes, we were also able to keep our phones charged, about an hour to fully charge phones
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my gate opener
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my gate opener. Has kept the battery charged for a full year with no problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Very nice trickle charger.
customer_reviews.text: I've got a car that sits most of the time. The battery would die all the time since it hardly got driven. Hooked this up and tossed it on the roof rack and voltage never drops now. Car is parked outdoors where it gets sunlight, doubt it would work in a garage.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Ho

customer_reviews.title: Easy charging solution
customer_reviews.text: This was a great choice for keeping a Marine battery charged in the summer,it will be used in the winter as well to charge smaller batteries. It was easy to install and hook up too! Good find/buy
customer_reviews.author: Master

customer_reviews.title: Still in use after a year
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for charging my batteries for my garden water system. Even when overcast it still gives power as long as I wipe it off every month to keep it clean
customer_reviews.author: MasterVernon

customer_reviews.title: It was working great for first several months but gradually failed to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item 6 months ago and it is now non functional! It was working great for first several months but gradually failed to keep my battery charged.
customer_reviews.author: Packard36

customer_reviews.title: Needed new solar panel to power a circulating pump in a solar hot water system
customer_reviews.text: needed a new solar panel to power a pump on a solar hot water system and this one worked much better then the original...
customer_reviews.author: Loxahatchee Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great battery charger
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a boat, RV, or any 12v battery systems you have. I use it to keep the batteries in my fishing boat topped off and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Great solar panel for small batteries and to start with.
customer_reviews.text: Great solar panel for small batteries and to start with. Pair this with a 12 volt sealed lead acid battery (for replacement in computer UPS systems, etc.) and you will have a great backup power system. It is great way to power a amateur radio transceiver.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Good product I believe for the price but time will tell
customer_reviews.text: It functions but the charge controller is not the one as pictured or described
customer_reviews.author: William Tuck

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: For a 20W panel it does the job. The controller is low end so not as efficient as it could be but it works. I use this to keep my boat batteries charged and it seems to do the job. For the price it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth h graham

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong for 2 years!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced solar panel charger for gate. It has been well worth it. Coming up on 2 years, no problems. I upgraded the device between it and the battery as recommended in othe post. Glad I did because the one that comes with it seemed cheaply made. Had to alter the mounting bracket slightly so it would fit. Would recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brett D Zeigler

customer_reviews.title: Easy.  Simple.  Works!
customer_reviews.text: I really like it!!! Could have used a disposable tool for the wires; or a mount for stuff ( like "velcro") or longer wires but nothing a little tape can't fix. CAN'T BEAT IT $$
customer_reviews.author: marc

customer_reviews.title: Great little panel for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great little panel for the money. The controller is bonus. Just keep in mind the power rating of the controller. May not be big enough for your project. I ended up purchasing a larger controller afterwards, which wasn't all that much money so no big deal. Worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lowell Jr

customer_reviews.title: Broken Glass
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box, the glass was shattered. The delivery person handed it to me, so it wasn't dropped and I didn't drop it. The package was just thin cardboard secured with thick tape that seemed to be nylon.
customer_reviews.author: kwg

customer_reviews.title: Takes a couple of days to charge a 12 volt ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes a couple of days to charge a 12 volt battery, but it does work, and a slow charge lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Wilosn

customer_reviews.title: room to improve
customer_reviews.text: panel works well , however brackets for mounting should be included, charge controller junk, worked for 1 day
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for charging anything 12. I use it to keep a car battery connected to my gate opener. Even with several days of rain, the battery and charger keep working
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little big for a car battery but even on cloudy days 12V lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I very much like the panel
customer_reviews.text: I very much like the panel, not so much the charge controller as it seems flimsy and fragile. I don't expect it to last too long. As for the panel, it's been attached to my fence charging 12v batteries with no issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Aubry

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my battery charged
customer_reviews.text: I bought this solar rig to keep my riding mower battery charged in my storage shed. After 10 days of use, it's working very well. I even hooked up a 12V light and switch to the "load" output, which is very handy. I only give it 4 stars because it doesn't come with a mounting bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Rimshot

customer_reviews.title: Panel great - controller not so much
customer_reviews.text: The panel is great. I use it for keeping the battery on my garden lawn mower full. However, the controller it comes with is useless. Even though I tried to protect it from the rain, the leads into the controller continued to rust out. It is difficult to get the rusted parts of the wire out of the little hole to be able to insert the re-cut wire.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: A Nice little unit. Worth its Price definitely! !
customer_reviews.text: ECO-WORTHY 20W 12V Solar Panel Kit: 20 Watt Polycrystalline Solar Panel & Battery Clips & 3A Charge Controller...I was worried it might be totally junk. When I opened it I was impressed by the quality of the panel. However, The parts they used to connect the wiring are a bit cheap, the wire soldering is not the best but it works!! But overall it's not a bad unit. I ordered this to try and maintain my battery while out trolling in my pontoon boat. Once I test it out I will edit this review..Buy this with confidence that your getting a decent quality Item for your money..
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Brown of Heber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent battery charger for my lawn tractor
customer_reviews.text: Excellent battery charger for my lawn tractor. No more dragging the power cords and charger out every couple months. I just leave this on for a week and I am good to go.
customer_reviews.author: rc hobbiest

customer_reviews.title: Charge controller died
customer_reviews.text: The charge controller died after a few days of charging a small 10ah battery
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Panel ok charger junk
customer_reviews.text: Charge controller quite working.gree light on but doesn't have power to the battery. Can't use the door opener.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory j logsdon

customer_reviews.title: Easy, great power output, robust.
customer_reviews.text: I love this solar panel as it keeps my 12v battery charged all throughout the day. The included solar controller is essential. Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Couch Mango

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this panel
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this panel. I am using it to help charge a battery for an electric fence. So far everything is working well. My only problem was trying to mount it. I have attached some pictures which I hope are helpful. Basically I purchased 4 utility poles at tractor supply. Then I purchased these brackets that mounted on the poles at an angle. Then lastly some 1/4inch bolts, washers, and nuts to attached the brackets to the panel. Total for the poles, brackets, and hardware was about $14.
customer_reviews.author: TNPHINFAN

customer_reviews.title: Quit working in 2 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: My panel / controller quit working after a couple weeks. The Green light o. The controller blinks but it won't charge any battery!!! Really disappointed and no way to contact the seller!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The wires are easily disconnected. Recommend taping them as they will pull ...
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be working as described. The wires are easily disconnected. Recommend taping them as they will pull free with little force.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: 25 W for $50!
customer_reviews.text: I have tested it to 21 Watts and I am confident it will reach its max potential at 25 W.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: No easy way to mount
customer_reviews.text: This is not an easy thing for someone to install in a DIY as there is no place to put a mounting bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Karina L. De Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: Panel works great the controller not so much. Need to find a better controller now.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel B.

customer_reviews.title: Controller does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Controller did not work out of the box. Panel output normal. Controller did not convert to 12 volts. Third try was a charm, worked. Now happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for RVs
customer_reviews.text: Works great to trickle charge my RV batteries while in storage.
customer_reviews.author: April Fraley

customer_reviews.title: LOW COST AND WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I have had this in the snow, wind and rain for two years, still works great no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to charge my boat and RV batteries, so far so good. The charge controller seems small and flimsy but has worked just fine to this point
customer_reviews.author: frank mcdaniel

customer_reviews.title: Well-made solar panel
customer_reviews.text: Excellent solar panel at a very good price. The package originally arrived without the controller, but the vendor was very responsive in sending one out after I contacted them with the problem. I'm using this to keep my boat battery charge topped off, since a lead-acid battery's worst enemy is sitting unused. The Panel works great for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: AndySki

customer_reviews.title: great tool for charging battery
customer_reviews.text: work well, charges 12v cycle battery fully on sunny day, then can run solar light for 18 hrs. from it
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Controller
customer_reviews.text: Controller doesn't seem to be doing anything and I see no one to contact about, guess it will have to go back?
customer_reviews.author: Jer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly, easy set up! It generates the power I need for my off grid cabin!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great solar panel
customer_reviews.text: Works at keeping the battery charged for our chicken coop
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product/Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work right out of the box. Messaged the company and they had me doing multiple test and sending them pictures to prove it didn’t work. After all the run around, the company did nothing to stand behind their product. Poor product/Poor customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Lea Quam

customer_reviews.title: good little solar cell
customer_reviews.text: I have it charging my camper batteries, and it is working flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Is working well on my electric fencer - it charges a large Interstate deep cycle battery.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the prewired wires to heavier wire (less current loss) and wired to my boat trolling motor to recharge it through the day. Seems to work great. I will probably buy another one for other applications
customer_reviews.author: Dana Garard

customer_reviews.title: Great value and product, and keep my pontoon batteries topped off.
customer_reviews.text: Great value and product, and keep my pontoon batteries topped off.
customer_reviews.author: mfriend93

customer_reviews.title: works for solar barn lights
customer_reviews.text: I used this with two 5W LED bulbs and a battery for a solar-powered automatic night light in my barn.
customer_reviews.author: Seneca reader

customer_reviews.title: A bit over priced for the over all quality!
customer_reviews.text: Almost 2 months of usage: The panel works well with no observed problems but the charge controller is clearly defective. The battery clips are relatively useful, however I believe the product may have been a bit over priced for the quality. I would suggest to purchase the panel by itself and along with it a good charge controller.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Grant

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Great for trailer not parked near electric but needs to be charged
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ECO-Worthy [Upgraded] 25 Watts 12V Off Grid Solar Panel SAE Connector Kit: Waterproof 25W Solar Panel + SAE Connection Cable +USB Controller for Light
feature_bullets: [Plug & Play] SAE connectors cable is easy to install and virtual free maintenance

[Widely Used] Ideal solar power kit for variety of off grid applications including chicken coop, gate opener, water pump, shed, cabin etc where 12V deep cycle battery is used as well as charge and maintain Cars, RVs, Boats, Trailer battery
[Durable Panel] Waterproof 25 Watt solar panel with 9.84ft SAE connector cable, SAE connectors easy to connect and disconnect with controller, plug and play
[Full Protections] USB charge controller prevents battery from over charge, dischage and short circuit, reversed polarity protection. Two indicators for checking status of charging and discharging
[Free Maintenance] 1 year warranty and 24/ 7 technical support team, call ECO-WORTHY hotline whatever any question or concern you have
